alert.note: Alert for Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 5:33AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, The Chilkoot Trail near the Taiya River in Skagway. * WHEN...Until 530 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in Areas along low lying portions of the Chilkoot Trail. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Taiya River. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Areas along low lying portions of the Chilkoot Trail is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Taiya River near Skagway: At 5:00am the stage was 16.4 feet. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: A crest near 17 feet is expected around 10:00am Saturday. Impacts: At 16.1 feet: Portions of the Chilkoot Trail begins to inundate with water. At 16.8 feet: Portions of the first few miles of the Chilkoot Trail will begin to inundate with water to ankle depth.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
